top_links.label: Top Links
top_links.comment: Links in the header: Account, Wishlist, Log In etc.

custom_logo.label: Upload Logo
custom_logo.comment: Allowed file types: PNG, GIF, JPG, JPEG. Not all browsers support all these formats!

custom_logo_small.label: Upload Logo Small
custom_logo_small.comment:
Show logo on mobile
Allowed file types: PNG, GIF, JPG, JPEG. Not all browsers support all these formats!

display_name_single_line.label: Display Name in Single Line
display_name_single_line.comment: In case product name is too long to be displayed in a single line, it will be clipped and an ellipsis will be appended at the end of the line to represent clipped text.

show_addtolinks.label: Show Add To Wishlist/ Compare Link

show_countdowntimer.label: Show Countdown Timer
show_countdowntimer.comment: Show countdown timer when product on sale

aspect_ratio.label: Keep Image Aspect Ratio
aspect_ratio.comment:
If set to Yes, it will keep aspect ratio of the product image (height of the image will be calculated automatically based on width).
If set to No, Magento will automatically transform each image into square. If the original image was rectangular, the empty space at the sides will be filled with white color.

image_width.label: Image Width
image_width.comment: If width is not specified, default width will be used (300 pixels). Remember that in the category view the visual size of the product image depends on the number of columns. For example, if you increase the number of columns, columns will be narrower so there will be less space for product image in each column.

alt_image.label: Alternative Image
alt_image.comment: Show alternative image on mouse hover over the product image.

alt_image_column.label: Select Alternative Image By Column
alt_image_column.comment: Which column of the product image gallery will mark alternative images of your products.

alt_image_column_value.label: Alternative Image Column Value
alt_image_column_value.comment: Specify the value which will mark alternative images of your products. E.g.: if Select Alt. Image By Column is set to "Sort Order", specify the number which will mark (in "Sort Order" column of the product image gallery) alternative images, for example: "2".

equal_height.label: Equal Height of Grid Items (Products)
equal_height.comment: If enabled, all grid items have the same height and "Add to cart" button is displayed at the bottom edge of the item.

equal_height_type.label: Equal Height Type
equal_height_type.comment:
Minimun Height: The height value of all item will change to the minimum height value in collection. You need hover mouse on item to shown full item content.
Maximum Height: The height value of all item will to the maximum height value in collection.

disable_hover_effect.label: Disable Hover Effect Below...
disable_hover_effect.comment: Product Hover Effect will be disabled if width of the browser viewport is below selected value.

product_image_heading.label: Product Main Image
product_image_heading.comment: The theme is using the Elevate Zoom plugin for main image. You can search and check all option of this plugin at here

zoom_lenssize.label: Lens Size
zoom_lenssize.comment: Used when zoomType set to lens, when zoom type is set to window, then the lens size is auto calculated.

zoom_scroll.label: Scroll
zoom_scroll.comment: Set to true to activate zoom on mouse scroll.

zoom_easing.label: Zoom Easing
zoom_easing.comment: Set to true to activate easing.

zoom_easing_type.label: Zoom Easing Type
zoom_easing_type.comment: Extend jquery with other easing types before initiating the plugin and pass the easing type as a string value.

zoom_easingduration.label: Easing Duration
zoom_easingduration.comment: Used when zoomType set to lens, when zoom type is set to window, then the lens size is auto calculated.

zoom_lensfadein.label: Lens Fade In
zoom_lensfadein.comment: Set as a number e.g 200 for speed of Lens fadeIn

zoom_lensfadeout.label: Lens Fade Out
zoom_lensfadeout.comment: Set as a number e.g 200 for speed of Lens fadeOut

zoom_windowfadein.label: Zoom Window Fade In
zoom_windowfadein.comment: Set as a number e.g 200 for speed of Window fadeIn

zoom_windowfadeout.label: Zoom Window Fade Out
zoom_windowfadeout.comment: Set as a number e.g 200 for speed of Window fadeOut

zoom_bordersize.label: Border Size
zoom_bordersize.comment: Border Size of the ZoomBox - Must be set here as border taken into account for plugin calculations

zoom_lensshape.label: Lens Shape
zoom_lensshape.comment: Can also be round (note that only modern browsers support round, will default to square in older browsers)

zoom_containlenszoom.label: Contain Lens Zoom
zoom_containlenszoom.comment: For use with the Lens Zoom Type. This makes sure the lens does not fall outside the outside of the image

zoom_lensopacity.label: Lens Opacity
zoom_lensopacity.comment: Used in combination with lensColour to make the lens see through. When using tint, this is overrided to 0

zoom_tint.label: Tint
zoom_tint.comment: Enable a tint overlay, other options: true

zoom_tintfadein.label: Zoom Tint Fade In
zoom_tintfadein.comment: Set as a number e.g 200 for speed of Tint fadeIn

zoom_tintfadeout.label: Zoom Tint Fade Out
zoom_tintfadeout.comment: Set as a number e.g 200 for speed of Tint fadeOut

zoom_tintcolour.label: Tint Colour
zoom_tintcolour.comment: Colour of the tint, can be #hex, word (red, blue), or rgb(x, x, x)

zoom_cursor.label: Cursor
zoom_cursor.comment: The default cursor is usually the arrow, if using a lightbox, then set the cursor to pointer so it looks clickable.

popoup_heading.label: Popup
popoup_heading.comment: The theme is using the Fancybox plugin for popup. You can search and check all option of this plugin at here

popup_customeffect.label: Addtions Config
popup_customeffect.comment:
One config per line. You can search and check all option of this plugin at here. All config in this box will ovveride exits config some config of Popup. Example:
autoPlay: true,
playSpeed: 1000,
loop: false,

Comma-separated.

product_additional_image_heading.label: Product Additional Images
product_additional_image_heading.comment: The theme is using the Jcarousellite carousel for addtion image. You can search and check all option of this plugin at here

visible.label: Items Visible
visible.comment: This specifies the number of items visible at all times within the carousel. The default is 3. You are even free to experiment with real numbers. Eg: "3.5" will have 3 items fully visible and the last item half visible. This gives you the effect of showing the user that there are more images to the right.

speed.label: Speed
speed.comment: Specifying a speed will slow-down or speed-up the sliding speed of your carousel. Try it out with different speeds like 800, 600, 1500 etc. Providing 0, will remove the slide effect.

scroll.label: Scroll more items
scroll.comment: You can scroll more than one item (the default), using this option. Provide the number of items to scroll, and the items will start scrolling by the specified number when the next or previous button is clicked.

auto_scroll.label: Auto-Scroll
auto_scroll.comment: Automatically scrolls content based on the time period given in the auto option.

non_circular.label: Non Circular
non_circular.comment: Carousels are circular by default. You have to explicitly disable circular behavior if you don't want them. Like this.

easing.label: Easing
easing.comment: Easing effect is the best thing that happened to jQuery, after jQuery itself. If you prefer the carousel to animate using an easing effect, all you need to do is supply one.

mouse_wheel.label: Mouse wheel navigation
mouse_wheel.comment: You can use the mouse wheel to scroll from one item to next, not necessarily buttons. Try scrolling your mouse wheel when you hover over the carousel and see what happens. This is not mutually exclusive with the navigation buttons. So, you can use both the navigation buttons and the mouse wheel in the same carousel if you want.

- Accordion - display Collateral Data in accordion

Put name of css files exclude to compress and merge with formats: skin_css/css/file1.css, skin_css/css/file2.css OR js_css/file1.css, js_css/file2.css

colors.comment: In this tab, you can configure basic colors. Settings from this tab are inherited by all the other sections. Some of the settings (such as text color) can be overridden in other sections.

icons.label: Icons
icons.comment: The theme is using Font Awesome. You can search all class at here

font_size.label: Basic Font Size
font_size.comment: Size of the regular text. Font size of most of the other elements will be calculated relative to this value.

primary_font_family_group.label: Font Family
primary_font_family_group.comment: Select predefined font stack, Google Fonts or type in your custom font stack.

primary_font_family_custom.label: Custom
primary_font_family_custom.comment:
Type in your custom font stack, e.g.:
Arial, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, sans-serif.
Important: Do not add trailing semicolon.

primary_font_family.label: Google Fonts
primary_font_family.comment:
Font preview is available on Google Web Fonts
Important: most of the fonts from Google are not available in all weights. Make sure that you specified correct weight (field Font Weight below) for selected font. Otherwise font will not be displayed. Refer to Google Web Fonts to check if the selected weight is available for your font.

primary_char_subset.label: Character Sets
primary_char_subset.comment:
Some of the fonts support multiple scripts (like Latin and Cyrillic for example). You need to select at least one character set.
Important: not all fonts support extended character sets. For a complete list of available fonts and font subsets refer to Google Web Fonts.
Important: using multiple character sets affects performance, so only select the character sets that you actually need.

primary_font_weight.label: Font Weight
primary_font_weight.comment:
Specify the weight of the font. You can only use numeric font weights which are available for the CSS property font-weight. E.g. normal weight is 400, bold is 700. Leave empty to use default weight.
Important: if you selected a font from Google Fonts, note that some fonts are not available in all weights. Refer to Google Web Fonts to check if the selected weight is available for your font.

bg_color.label: Background Color
bg_color.comment: Background color of the web browser viewport (applied for HTML body element). Set the same color as for footer background to avoid blank space below the footer on large screens.

header.label: Header
header.comment: In this tab, you can configure the header section.

padding_top.label: Top Padding
padding_top.comment: Specify additional gap above the header section.

padding_bottom.label: Bottom Padding
padding_bottom.comment: Specify additional gap below the header section.

search_max_width.label: Maximum Width
search_max_width.comment:
Use to decrease the maximum width of the search box. It works similar to CSS property max-width. Example values: 200px, 75%, 10em. Leave empty to use the default width.
Important: don't forget to specify the unit.
